page.description: Specify the buttons that, when clicked, will navigate to specific Panels in the Panel Navigator.

discussion.p: The *[ui:Tab buttons]* property is used to define a button that shows a Panel in the Panel Navigator when the button is clicked.

section.title: Defining Tab Buttons
section.description: Tab buttons are defined using the *[ui:Navigator Tab Buttons]* genie. For each Panel in the Panel Navigator, the ID of the button that, when pressed, gives focus to a Panel must be defined. :

step.description: Click the [...] smart field button to open the *[ui:Navigator Tab Buttons]* genie.
Click *[ui:Add Button Controller]* to assign a Button to a Panel.
Select the Button and the Panel that will be shown when the button is clicked and click *[ui:OK]*.

section.description: If a button or panel for a button controller definition is missing, a red dot will appear next to the button ID. If a button does not use Advanced Button Styling, which is recommended for Button controls that will be used as tab buttons, a blue dot will appear next to the button ID in the *[ui:Navigator Tab Buttons]* dialog. Use the *[ui:Delete Button Controller]* or *[ui:Edit Button Controller]* buttons to remove or update the selected button controller.

description.p: If no Button controls are defined in the UX Component, you may see the following error message when you click the [...] smart field button to open the *[ui:Navigator Tab Buttons]* genie to define a tab button. To resolve this, add a Button control to the UX Component. Then, click the *[ui:Tab buttons]* [...] button to define a tab button.
